title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: What’s the fuss about aluminum in vaccines?
items.description: Despite extensive safety record, U.S. health advisers are set to discuss claimed link to asthma

items.title: 100 years on, quantum mechanics is redefining reality—with us at the center
items.description: Increasingly popular theories hold that experimental outcomes really do depend on the observer

items.title: ‘Incredible’ carved canoe dates back to first settlement of islands near New Zealand
items.description: Fibers found on waka in Chatham Islands roughly align in age with earliest known human arrival

items.title: Medieval volcano may have indirectly sparked Europe’s Black Death
items.description: Crop failures caused by eruptions possibly forced grain imports from plague-ridden regions

items.title: Watch this tiny robot somersault through the air like an insect
items.description: Device weighing less than a paperclip is faster and more agile than its predecessors

items.title: To boost research, states are building their own AI-ready supercomputers
items.description: New York aims to democratize access to hardware often limited to federal labs and Big Tech

items.title: Satellite fleets pose problems for space telescopes, too
items.description: Proposed “megaconstellations” would contaminate images from telescopes in low-Earth orbit, including Hubble

items.title: As Energy Department prioritizes AI and fusion, basic research faces squeeze
items.description: Reorganization could shift mission of the United States’s largest funder of the physical sciences

items.title: Brain’s ‘plumbing’ inspires new Alzheimer’s strategies—and controversial surgeries
items.description: Animal studies support idea that boosting fluid clearance could blunt neurological disorders

items.title: Seeking greater independence, Europe boosts space agency budget
items.description: X-ray observatory and mission to Saturn’s moon Enceladus win as ESA’s science program sees growth
